Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Formulate \For"mu*late\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Formulated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Formulating}.] To reduce to, or express in, a formula; to put in a clear and definite form of statement or expression. --G. P. Marsh. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: formulated \formulated\ adj. reduced to a systematic form; reduced to a formula. [WordNet 1.5 +PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
developed \developed\ adj. 1. being changed over time so as to be e.g. stronger or more complete or more useful; as, the developed qualities of the Hellenic outlook; the state's well-developed industries. Oppositre of {undeveloped}. [Narrower terms: {formulated}; {mature}] [WordNet 1.5]
2. made more useful and profitable as by building or laying out roads; -- of real estate. new houses are springing up on the developed tract of land near the river
Syn: improved. [WordNet 1.5]
formulated adj : devised; developed according to an orderly plan; "he had well formulated opinions on schooling"
